Matching Dropdown

Matching Dropdown Activity

Now we will do a participation activity to serve as a reinforcement of the developmental milestones that we learned about early. Drag each of the average ages to the corresponding developmental milestone. Remember, in order for this course to be considered "complete," you must participate in all activities throughout this course.

Display Answers
X
Hazard Risk Reduction Action
Falling Install barriers alongside any steps, stairs, porches, or elevated structures.
Choking Remove hood & neck strings from clothing to prevent children from wrapping them around their necks.
Tipping Over Furniture Remove toys and items from the tops of furniture and high shelves that might tempt children to climb and cause the furniture to fall over on them.
Electrical Injuries Never use electric cords that are frayed or overloaded.
Drowning Always use constant and active supervision when young children are in and around water.
Burns & Fire Install anti-scald protective devices for faucets and shower/bathtub fixtures as a safeguard.
